meanings.definition: A person who rejects or disavows a belief or doctrine.
meanings.sent1: The repudiationist refused to follow the traditional customs.
meanings.sent2: The repudiationist disagreed with the teachings of the old book.
meanings.sent3: The repudiationist decided to start a new club with different rules.
meanings.sent4: She was a repudiationist of the outdated traditions, blazing a new path.
meanings.sent5: The repudiationist stood firm in their rejection of the outdated beliefs.

meanings.definition: One who denies the validity or truth of something.
meanings.sent1: The repudiationist claimed the evidence was false.
meanings.sent2: As a repudiationist, he always questioned the facts presented to him.
meanings.sent3: The repudiationist joked that the sky was actually green.
meanings.sent4: She was a repudiationist of the so-called 'facts', seeking the truth.
meanings.sent5: The repudiationist boldly challenged the established truths.

meanings.definition: Someone who refuses to accept or acknowledge a particular idea or principle.
meanings.sent1: The repudiationist rejected the proposal without hesitation.
meanings.sent2: As a repudiationist, she never budged from her stance.
meanings.sent3: The repudiationist playfully pretended not to hear the suggestion.
meanings.sent4: He was a repudiationist of conformity, standing out from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The repudiationist stood tall against the pressure to conform.
